meanings.definition: Retrofit: to add or incorporate new features or equipment to something existing
meanings.sent1: She retrofits her old car with a new stereo system.
meanings.sent2: The company retrofits old buildings with energy-efficient lighting.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic retrofits the broken bike with shiny new parts.
meanings.sent4: He retrofits his wardrobe with trendy clothes to stay fashionable.
meanings.sent5: The handyman retrofits the house with smart technology for convenience.

meanings.definition: Retrofit: an instance of adding new features or equipment to something existing
meanings.sent1: The retrofit of the office building included new air conditioning units.
meanings.sent2: The retrofit of the playground added colorful new swings for the children.
meanings.sent3: The retrofits in the kitchen made cooking more enjoyable for the chef.
meanings.sent4: The retrofit of the computer system improved efficiency in the office.
meanings.sent5: The retrofits in the museum exhibit enhanced the visitor experience.
